newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber closes up on Thai, Tokyo factors.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber closes up on Thai, Tokyo factors.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were quoted higher at the close as producers banked on news of heavy rains in Thailand and a strong finish in Tokyo futures, traders said.
But a proposal by the U.S. National Defence Stockpile Centre to sell 60,000 tonnes of rubber by early 1997 was keeping buyers from taking long positions, traders added.

"There's mixed sentiment in the market. It's bullish because of Thailand and bearish because of the stock pile," said a trader. Traders said if floods hit Thailand and affect production, Malaysian and Indonesian prices could rise as well.
